english: Who is the Japanese teacher?
hint: Several teachers are present in the teachers' room

answers.notes: Using が to identify which specific person among the teachers is the Japanese teacher
Using は to ask about the Japanese teacher's identity in general

english: In this class, who is the international student?
hint: Looking around at classroom members

segments: 留学生[りゅうがくせい]
answers.notes: Using で to specify the location first, then asking who within that space is the international student

segments: 留学生[りゅうがくせい]
answers.notes: Using の to ask who holds the role of 'this class's international student'

english: Who among them is from Korea?
hint: Looking at a group of people

answers.notes: Using が to identify which specific person in the group is Korean
Using は to ask about the Korean person's identity in general

english: Whose English textbook is this?
hint: Looking at a textbook on a desk

answers.notes: Full sentence emphasizing 'this' textbook specifically
More natural, casual version focusing just on asking about ownership

english: At this university, who is a doctor?
hint: Discussing university staff members

answers.notes: Using で to first establish the location (university), then asking who within that space is a doctor
Using の to ask who holds the position of doctor at this university

english: Who is a first-year student here?
hint: In a classroom with multiple students

answers.notes: Using で to ask about who in this location is a first-year
Using の to ask about who belongs to this place as a first-year

Using は to ask about the English teacher's identity in general

Using の to ask about who serves as this school's nurse
